text: Atriplex truncata is a species of saltbush known by the common names wedgeleaf saltbush, wedgescale, and wedge orach, native to western North America from British Columbia to California and to New Mexico. It grows in montane to desert habitats with saline soils, such as dry lake beds. ==Description== Atriplex truncata is an annual herb producing erect, angled stems which can be higher than 70 centimeters. Leaves are 1 to 4 centimeters long and wedge- shaped. The stems and herbage are generally very scaly and scurfy. Male and female flowers are produced in small clusters in the leaf axils. ==External links== *Jepson Manual Treatment *USDA Plants Profile for Atriplex truncata (wedgescale saltbush) *Photo gallery truncata Category:Halophytes Category:Flora of the Northwestern United States Category:Flora of Western Canada Category:Flora of British Columbia Category:Flora of California Category:Flora of Colorado Category:Flora of Nevada Category:Flora of New Mexico Category:Flora of Utah Category:Flora of the California desert regions Category:Flora of the Great Basin Category:Flora of the Rocky Mountains Category:Flora of the Sierra Nevada (U.S.) Category:Natural history of the Mojave Desert Category:Natural history of the Transverse Ranges Category:Plants described in 1871
